report_title: Office Staffing and Temp Agencies Industry Report
executive_summary: Office staffing and temp agencies have grown because of a burgeoning US labor market. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), the US economy added 272,000 new jobs on average in May 2024, with notable growth in health care, social assistance, financial activities and wholesale trade sectors. As inflationary concerns lingered, job growth remained positive throughout the economy. So industry-wide revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 3.1% over the past five years, including an estimated 10.6% in 2024, totaling $274.6 billion in 2024. In the same year, profit will remain at 5.4% of industry revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Economy Determines the Success of the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The success of office staffing and temp agencies directly correlates with the health of the business environment and economy. A thriving economy boosts demand for their services, driving growth. During weak economic growth or recessions, companies prefer to let go of temporary workers before permanent staff. This practice decreases demand for temporary workers during economic downturns. The Center for American Progress (CAP) indicates that constant fiscal support during COVID-19 has fostered a resilient job market, which rebounded more quickly than previous economic recessions. Ongoing inflation has stressed wages, resulting in a labor market imbalance. According to Fitch Ratings, this imbalance cannot be resolved without the likelihood of future job losses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE PATIENT PROTECTION AND AFFORDABLE CARE ACT (PPACA) INCREASES LABOR COST
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: PPACA requires businesses with over 50 employees to provide minimum healthcare coverage to all full-time workers, increasing labor costs for most office staffing and temp agencies. The PPACA has encouraged US businesses with over 50 employees to manage their workforce through temp staffing agencies. This strategy helps companies avoid the obligations and potential costs associated with the employer mandate by seeking contingent workers rather than hiring permanent employees directly. Since a significant share of temp staffing agencies manage 50 or more employees, this law has increased labor costs for most companies, particularly the largest businesses like Adecco and ManpowerGroup. Conversely, the PPACA has presented an opportunity for agencies because increased costs encourage large US businesses to seek contingent workers through temp staffing agencies rather than directly hiring permanent workers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: STAFFING AGENCIES ARE SOUGHT AFTER BY AMERICANS AND BUSINESSES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Businesses with highly seasonal performance have been better able to manage volatile work volumes by hiring temporary staff to expand or shrink their workforce quickly. A weaker labor market encouraged many unemployed Americans to join the labor force through temp staffing agencies as a stepping stone toward a more permanent position in the future. The need for contingent workers from the professional sectors (e.g., healthcare, information technology and engineering) helped the industry before the COVID-19 pandemic. A growing number of discouraged Americans who were unable to secure permanent full-time positions have accepted temporary work through staffing agencies. Since the pandemic, agencies have noted increasing demand for flexible work arrangements. This shift indicates a major alteration in employment norms, presenting new opportunities and challenges for agencies. Nevertheless, the work-from-home trend mandates a rethink of worker benefits and welfare. Agencies must reevaluate what constitutes a competitive benefits package in this new scenario.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A R T I F I C I A L  I N T E L L I G E N C E  ( A I )  I S  R E V O L U T I O N I Z I N G R E C R U I T M E N T  F O R  S T A F F I N G  A G E N C I E S
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rapid technological advancements are reshaping the staffing and temp agency industry. Agencies that don't adapt risk losing their competitive edge and potentially losing business to more tech-savvy competitors. AI technology is revolutionizing recruitment by efficiently and precisely screening resumes. It highlights essential candidate information, fast-tracking the selection process and significantly improving recruitment efficiencies. Likewise, AI algorithms match candidates to job openings based on skills and experience. This precise matching increases the likelihood of successful placements and reduces turnover rates. AI-powered chatbots also handle initial candidate inquiries and scheduling.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Current Economic Situation Will Present Opportunities for Staffing Agencies
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Temporary personnel is increasingly becoming a permanent fixture in corporate strategies across the United States due to the flexibility they offer employers. The industry is forecast to grow at a faster rate as corporate profit rises, with businesses projected to become more comfortable hiring full-time employees rather than temporary ones. Conversely, improved economic conditions will likely drive workers who previously left the labor force to seek new opportunities again. This shift can boost the available talent pool for employers. Still, businesses may lose confidence in their long-term financial stability, thereby maintaining demand for temporary workers despite the hike in corporate profits. Although the Federal Reserve anticipates lowering interest rates, the economy's current trajectory remains uncertain.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand in the Professional Services Sector Will Soar
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising demand from the Professional, Scientific and Technical Services sector (IBISWorld report 54) will expand quickly as the economy and the Accommodation and Food Services sector (72) grow. The sustained implementation of healthcare programs will likely be crucial for the continued demand in the Healthcare and Social Assistance sector (62); this, in turn, will drive hospitals and healthcare facilities to boost their need for temporary labor. Likewise, demand from the Accommodation and Food Services sector (72) is expected to significantly increase as higher incomes for Americans translate into greater spending on dining and travel.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Fragmentation Will Define the Staffing Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite ongoing mergers and acquisitions among large firms, office staffing and temp agencies will continue to expand. Small agencies thrive by catering to niche markets, offering tailored and unique services that meet specific client needs. Demand for temporary staff will keep surging, inspiring unemployed or discouraged individuals to re-enter the labor force through contractual arrangements. This trend will create a dynamic shift in the workforce landscape. Temporary workers aren't directly hired by the clients they work for; they're considered employees of the temp staffing agency. This arrangement allows clients to access flexible labor without the responsibilities of direct employment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: OFFICE STAFFING AND TEMP AGENCIES WILL NEED TO ADAPT TO NEW TECHNOLOGIES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: AI technology will attempt to streamline recruitment with an eye for improved efficiency, allowing recruiters to focus on preparing for interviews and engaging with candidates. Companies increasingly use AI to sift through numerous resumes and applications. As AI-based tools increasingly permeate the US job market, temp agencies and office staff must adapt to stay relevant.

industry_definition: Office staffing and temp agencies supply businesses with workers for limited periods to supplement existing staff. Although temp workers remain employees of the temp agency, temp agencies do not provide direct supervision of their employees at clients' work sites.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Number of temporary employees

key_trends: Ensuring client satisfaction requires high service levels and flexible solutions. Office staffing and temp agencies stay competitive by
Effectively evaluating and training temporary placement candidates

The external competition includes companies placing permanent employees and offering temp services. The Employment and Recruiting Agencies industry (IBISWorld report 56131) also provides similar services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment comprises various sectors, such as construction, which is responsible for building infrastructure; manufacturing, which assembles finished goods; mining, which extracts valuable minerals; and other pivotal industrial sectors.

This segment encompasses a range of sectors, including professional services like law and consulting, various business industries, healthcare services and institutions and financial markets, including banking and investment businesses.

This sector encompasses IT services like software development, system integration and cloud computing. It also comprises engineering and scientific fields like civil engineering, biotechnology, environmental science and others. Workers within this segment are highly skilled professionals with postsecondary degrees and several years of experience, like scientists and other staff hired to undertake research projects for business clients across various sectors.

The other market segment encompasses diverse fields, including event catering services, traditional and online educational institutions, television broadcasting, and various other industries. This wide range highlights the versatility of temporary staffing solutions.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes administrative officers, bill collectors, bookkeepers, clerks, customer service representatives, loan officers, receptionists, secretaries, tellers and a variety of other administrative staff.

Industrial staffing positions cater to different blue-collar industries like manufacturing, logistics, construction and hospitality, providing workforce solutions for specialized tasks and projects. Temporary workers help businesses adapt to seasonal demand fluxes and better implement just-in-time manufacturing, curbing labor costs and

This segment includes doctors, dentists, dietitians, nutritionists, optometrists, pharmacists, chiropractors, registered nurses, therapists, veterinarians, clinical technicians, opticians and other healthcare and technical professionals.

IT staffing represents computer programmers, computer systems analysts, database developers, network administrators, operating system specialists, Software Designers and Developers, Software Engineers, Website Developers and Other IT Professionals

This segment includes the supply of aeronautical engineers, chemical engineers, civil engineers, electrical engineers, environmental engineers, industrial engineers, mechanical engineers, petroleum engineers and quality control engineers.

Professional service staffing includes the supply of accountants, actuaries, auditors, financial analysts, lawyers, managers and other experienced personnel to various professional and service-oriented sectors.

Other staff in diverse fields include counselors who provide guidance, creative and performing artists for visual expression, librarians managing resources, surveyors mapping territories, teachers offering education, translators breaking language barriers and writers creating texts.

tier_1_suppliers: Office Supply Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Changes in employees' attitudes and willingness to work temporarily
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Changes in employees' attitudes and willingness to work temporarily can increase or decrease the number of available workers. Increasing the number of temporary employees benefits businesses because companies receive greater demand for this type of staff. Also, workers striving to reenter the labor force will likely consider temporary roles in pursuing permanent positions, representing a potential opportunity for the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The region contains a share of the industry in line with its general population, with over a quarter of the industry jobs and the country's general population. Florida is a leading state in this region, with its establishments employing more individuals compared to the national average, demonstrating a robust and thriving job market.

Cities like Chicago and Detroit are home to many industries, such as automotive and manufacturing, which require a large number of specialized temp workers. As the population grows, businesses expand, requiring more office staff; this fuels demand for temporary staffing agencies, which provide immediate, cost-effective solutions to meet increasing workforce needs.

Like the Southeast, the West generates a portion of the temp agency industry that is in line with its share of the domestic population. California leads all US states in the number of established industries; this includes diverse sectors from tech to agriculture. Its thriving economy fosters entrepreneurship and innovation.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Fair Labor Standards Act governs wages and working hours in the US. The FLSA mandates minimum wage, overtime pay, recordkeeping and child labor standards for office staffing and temp agencies. Agencies must meticulously track hours worked by temp employees to ensure compliance with overtime rules, which require time-and-a-half pay for hours worked over 40 a week. Non-compliance can lead to hefty fines and legal challenges.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: OSHA enforces workplace safety and health standards and staffing agencies and host employers are responsible for ensuring the safety of temp workers. This involves providing adequate training and personal protective equipment (PPE) and addressing workplace hazards. For instance, if a temp worker is placed in an office environment that requires handling hazardous materials, the staffing agency must ensure the worker is adequately trained and informed about potential risks. Failure to comply can lead to inspections, fines and even shutdowns.

The ACA employer mandate requires businesses with 50 or more full-time employees (or equivalent) to provide health insurance to at least 95% of their full-time workforce. For office staffing and temp agencies, tracking full-time equivalents becomes crucial. Not providing the requisite health benefits can lead to significant penalties.

IRCA requires employers, including staffing agencies, to verify the employment eligibility of their employees via Form I-9 and the E-Verify system. Non-compliance can result in significant fines and legal issues. This is particularly pertinent for staffing and temp agencies with numerous short-term hires. An agency placing temporary administrative assistants must ensure that each new hire completes an I-9 form and that they verify the information within the prescribed timeframe to avoid penalties.

The EEOC enforces federal laws prohibiting discrimination against job applicants and employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Staffing agencies must be diligent in hiring to avoid discriminatory practices. Additionally, all employment practices, from recruiting to placement, should be documented to ensure transparency and compliance.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Regulatory compliance necessitates specialized legal knowledge and practices for new office staffing and temp agencies.

Most US states require a license to operate. In some states, a counselor's license is required for any person who interviews, counsels or advises candidates and clients on matters related to employment and contracts.

basis_points.basis_description: Ensuring client satisfaction requires high service levels and flexible solutions.
Office staffing and temp agencies stay competitive by effectively evaluating and training temporary placement candidates.
The external competition includes companies placing permanent employees and offering temp services.
The Employment and Recruiting Agencies industry (IBISWorld report 56131) also provides similar services.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Determining accurate market share concentration for office staffing and temp agencies is challenging because of the complexities of international accounting practices.
Different standards and regulations globally make precise calculations difficult.
Under international accounting practices, companies are only required to report net sales figures, the percentage of a temporary staffer's salary that the agency keeps as a fee for placing them.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Several other factors impact profit for office staffing and temp agencies. Key expenses include insurance premiums, interest, and travel, accommodation, and entertainment costs.
Several other factors impact profit for office staffing and temp agencies. Key expenses include insurance premiums, interest, and travel, accommodation, and entertainment costs.
Several other factors impact profit for office staffing and temp agencies. Key expenses include insurance premiums, interest, and travel, accommodation, and entertainment costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Agencies often face variable demand, resulting in fluctuating and higher labor costs than static industries because of the need for readily available staff. Permanent staff costs are high because they must provide personal, face-to-face service to clients and job applicants.

volatility_points.volatility_title: VOLATILITY INCREASES WITH RISING UNEMPLOYMENT RATES
volatility_points.volatility_description: Service demand significantly correlates with the US labor market and national unemployment rate fluctuations. Robust labor markets stimulate demand, while high unemployment levels tend to drop it.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Seasonal Dependence Has Its Perks and Risks
volatility_points.volatility_description: Seasonal industries predominantly use temporary workers for short-duration tasks, thus contributing significantly to the overall revenue of temporary placement agencies. Conversely, in slow periods, seasonal industries often downsize their temporary workforce. This practice can lead to considerable labor market instability and unpredictability in the industry's revenue streams.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online services have dramatically changed the way Americans search for jobs and how companies find suitable candidates. Online services offer automatic job notifications, career advice and resume counseling services infringing on services usually provided by office staffing and temp agencies.

AI is increasingly influencing various business sectors, including staffing agencies, enhancing efficiency, streamlining operations and increasing the effectiveness of personnel recruitment and management strategies. AI in recruitment helps automate resume screening, highlighting key information like skills, experience and qualifications, making the selection process efficient and less biased.

FAQs.question: What are the EEOC regulations for staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: The EEOC enforces federal laws prohibiting discrimination against job applicants and employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Staffing agencies must be diligent in hiring to avoid discriminatory practices. Additionally, all employment practices, from recruiting to placement, should be documented to ensure transparency and compliance.

FAQs.question: What assistance is provided by industry associations like ASA?
FAQs.answer: Organizations like ASA provide private support to office staffing and temp agencies through training, certifications, legal advice, public relations materials and educational materials for new and established agencies. ASA is the most prominent industry association that works for the benefit of industry members. Founded in 1966, ASA also provides its affiliates with public advocacy campaigns to benefit the industry's interests.

FAQs.question: How important are repeat clients and long-term contracts for staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: Repeat clients and long-term contracts are very important for temporary staffing agencies to generate revenue. By providing high-quality temp workers in a timely fashion, an agency can become a company's go-to when needing supplementary staffing.

FAQs.question: Do staffing agencies specialize or provide bundled services?
FAQs.answer: Most temporary staffing agencies specialize in staffing workers in a specific sector within a defined geographic region.

FAQs.question: Do staffing agencies target niche markets or broad markets?
FAQs.answer: Depending on its size, a temporary staffing agency decides whether to provide temporary workers to a defined sector or a wide variety of industries.

FAQs.question: Are repeat/recurring customers vital for staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: By consistently providing high-quality temporary workers to a business, a temporary staffing firm can guarantee continued business from new and existing clients.

FAQs.question: Are web technologies like online storage and video conferencing hurting staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: Online document storage and video conferencing are helping improve temporary staffing agencies' efficiencies. These tools allow agencies to conduct deep analysis and more easily interview potential candidates.

FAQs.question: Do staffing agencies use mobile apps?
FAQs.answer: Mobile apps have greatly enhanced the ability of temporary staffing agencies to collect and analyze candidates' resumes. This helps agencies build a more extensive database of qualified candidates when a role needs to be filled.

FAQs.question: Do regulations for staffing agencies vary by state?
FAQs.answer: Outside of state-specific licensing that an agency must obtain in each state, no law prevents temporary staffing agencies from conducting business in multiple states.

FAQs.question: Is state certification/licensing required for staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: Obtaining the required state certifications and licensing is the most significant regulatory obstacle that temporary staffing agencies face.

FAQs.question: How do staffing agencies compensate for seasonal cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Some temporary staffing agencies compensate for seasonal employment in certain sectors by providing staffing services to other, less seasonal sectors.

FAQs.question: How frequently do staffing agencies purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Temporary staffing agencies require little capital to operate, making new equipment purchases relatively infrequent.

FAQs.question: Do staffing agencies focus on particular sectors? How can they expand?
FAQs.answer: Agencies must secure and maintain access to a suitable supply of flexible, reliable and appropriately skilled workers available at short notice for placement.

FAQs.question: How important are relationships with market leaders for staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: The ability to secure repeat customers will have a positive effect on an agency's performance.

FAQs.question: How can staffing agencies promote higher-margin temp-to-permanent services?
FAQs.answer: Since the nature of the industry creates high revenue with low profitability, it's important to understand critical financial operations.

FAQs.question: How does the business sentiment index affect staffing agencies?
FAQs.answer: The BSI only grows when businesses display a greater degree of confidence in the US economy. When businesses exhibit greater confidence, they are considered more likely to hire temporary employees to supplement their existing workforce.

FAQs.question: How does corporate profit affect staffing agency revenue?
FAQs.answer: An increase in corporate profit has mixed effects on demand for the industry's services. Clients are more likely to invest in their workforce when funds are available. Increasing confidence in their financial stability can encourage them to hire permanent rather than temporary employees.

FAQs.question: How can staffing agencies make temporary staffers more competitive?
FAQs.answer: An increase in temporary employees benefits the industry because they receive greater demand from businesses for this type of staff.
